Description.Details: Ambush explosive IED
Description.Name: DamageIED

Description.Details: Flamer weapons are unique in that they deal little physical damage but instead expel superheated plasma, applying substantial heat to their target. When done properly, this can hamper enemy return fire or even cause the targeted unit to shut down from overheating.
Description.Name: Infantry Flamer

Description.Details: The LRM10 rack of Long-Range Missiles occupies a supporting fire role when mounted on most units, with fairly low damage balanced by low heat and ammunition consumption. Like all LRMs, LRM10s are capable of indirect fire over obstacles and terrain with the benefit of a spotter unit.
Description.Name: Infantry LRM

Description.Details: A flexible weapon, AC/5s strike a balance between long range, power, and performance. These weapons are commonly found on medium 'Mechs as their primary source of reliable damage. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/5s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire.
Description.Name: Infantry Rifles

Description.Details: The midtier rack of Short-Range Missiles, SRM4s deal good damage for comparatively few negatives other than their inherently short range and need for ammunition. As for all SRMs, SRM4 shots deal above-average stability impact per hit compared to other weapons.
Description.Name: Infantry SRM

Description.Details: With the advancements of AMS laser-based technology, this advanced version of the Clan Laser AMS is capable of protecting multiple units within range from missile salvos. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: Laser Anti Missile System

Description.Details: This massive Rotary Autocannon has reduced tonnage and space, a devastating weapon specifically modified to be able to be mounted on the ''Little Friend'' by a group of clanner Urbanmech worshipers, the downside is not being able to use it on any other mechs due to the extreme integration with mech's systems. Can fire in multiple modes, with higher amount of shots increasing jamming chance. Uses RAC20 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: RAC20 (LF)

Description.Details: The latest Railgun variant downscaled set to mountable into normal mech sized mech chassis. This versions brings a lot more improvements and a radical change in space conservation. The downside to this radical of an upgrade, is that the mech used in this, the Stone Rhino - R, has this permanently affixed into the chassis, sacrificing adaptability for role specialization. A specialized CASE system that spreads its capacitors safely around the torso makes it safer to use. Experimental close range firemode unlocked. Uses Railgun Ammo.
Description.Name: Prototype Railgun

Description.Details: The Tight Stream Electro Magnetic Pulse Cannon is a directed energy weapon based on the Taser system, but doesn't require the cabling and capacitors. This version was specifically tailored for close quarters combat. Fires in melee.
Description.Name: TSEMP Damios

Description.Details: The Mech's Systems have been scrambled.
Description.Name: TSEMP

Description.Details: The Mech's Movement is reduced.
Description.Name: Walk Impaired

Description.Details: The Mech's cooling is impaired.
Description.Name: Cooling Impaired

Description.Details: Clan scientists managed to stabilize experimental RISC RAC10, while reducing it size, at the cost of an extra ton of weight. Uses RAC10 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: RAC10 (C)

Description.Details: Clan scientists managed to stabilize experimental RISC RAC20, while reducing it size, at the cost of an extra ton of weight. Uses RAC20 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: RAC20 (C)

Description.Details: The Railgun is a massive weapon adapted from WarShips to be used on BattleMechs. Clan technology has allowed such a massive weapon to fit a relative small space. The powerful weapon decimates enemy 'Mechs with a single, well-placed shot, but only a few 'Mechs are able to mount. This one was specially downscaled for Assault mechs on the CT. Experimental close range firemode unlocked. Uses Railgun Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Down-Scaled Railgun

Description.Details: A Clan Wolverine prototype Rotary AntiPersonal Large Bore Gauss Rifle, or RAPLBGR. With probably the worst acronym ever, this weapon is a reconceptualization of Project Omega's RGR, mainly made for annihilation of Elementals and infantry units from, but capable enough to damage other mechs. Uses RAPLBGR Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: RAPLBGR (C)
Description.UIName: Rotary AP Large Bore Gauss Rifle (C)

Description.Details: A Clan Wolverine prototype Rotary Gauss Rifle. First Conceptualized on Project Omega, now added into a RACzilla's chassis. Generates a lot more heat for each shot fired. Has a special ''Overload'' mode, this mode shots a single superheated gauss shot which causes heavy damage to any targets, using this mode is normally not recommended since it causes heavy stress on the weapon, but helps in saving ammo. Uses Gauss Ammo. REALLY VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Rotary Gauss Rifle (C)

Description.Details: A Clan Society prototype Heavy Silver Bullet Gauss Rifle, what would later become the Hyper Assault Gauss Rifle, firing submunitions capable to utterly crush any target it is aimed at. Uses Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Gauss Rifle (C)

Description.Details:
The Contained Overflow Inertia Linkage—COIL— system of beam weaponry translates power from motion into a kinetic battery for rapid release. In practical terms, this means that the farther a unit moves in a turn (tracked as EVASIVE charges), the more damage it can dish out with its COIL attack, and the more Heat it generates.

COIL weapons will explode if destroyed, devastating the installed location. The COIL-L generates the highest-yield attack output of these weapon types.
Description.Name: COIL-L

Description.Name: AMS

Description.Name: Clan AMS

Description.Details: The Anti-Missile System is used to destroy missiles before they strike their target. The Blankenburg Technologies MacArthur II offers increased protection through a extremely sophisticed targetting system enabling it to track any and all Incoming Missiles. Uses AMS Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: AMS MK2

Description.Details: The Laser Anti-Missile System (LAMS) is an advanced variation of the standard Anti-Missile Systems. While the standard system utilizes a machine gun linked to specialized tracking systems, the LAMS uses a Small Pulse Laser, ensuring that the system never runs out of ammunition. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: LAMS

Description.Details: This unique Armor has an Integrated LAMS Prototype, capable to defend its owner and allies from the majority of Missile Attacks made during Battle. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: LAMS

This was a LAMS from a WLF-1X, but they slapped a APDS tracking system in it, hotwired a capacitor into it and jury rigged the lensing system of what looks to be Large Pulse Laser into this..... Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode

Description.Details: The Arrow IV is a stand-alone, missile based, artillery system, designed to augment conventional systems such as the Long Tom and the Sniper. It was first introduced by the Terran Hegemony in 2600 and became a staple of the Star League Defense Force. Although the technology to create Arrow IVs was lost during the Star League's collapse, it was recovered by Capellan Confederation engineers in 3044 working off of surviving examples and the Helm Memory Core. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode Uses ArrowIV Ammo.
Description.Name: Arrow IV

Description.Details: The Long Tom Artillery Piece is the largest conventional artillery piece designed by Armstrong Industries. It is the primary weapon of the LT-MOB-25 Mobile Long Tom Artillery vehicle, which is better known as the Mobile Long Tom. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode Uses LongTom Ammo.
Description.Name: Long Tom Artillery

Description.Details: The Long Tom Artillery Cannon is a scaled down version of the Long Tom Artillery Piece designed for use as an on-board indirect fire weapon. Capable of being mounted on 'Mechs, combat vehicles, and AeroSpace Fighters, the Long Tom Cannon is a snub-nosed version of the artillery piece of the same name. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode Uses LongTom Ammo.
Description.Name: Long Tom Cannon

Description.Details: The Sniper Rifle Artillery Piece is the smaller cousin to the Long Tom Artillery Piece designed by Armstrong Industries. As the second most-powerful tube artillery in the Inner Sphere, the Sniper can cripple or destroy most light and medium BattleMechs with a single hit. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode Uses Sniper Ammo.
Description.Name: Sniper Artillery

Description.Details: The Sniper Rifle Artillery Piece is the smaller cousin to the Long Tom Artillery Piece designed by Armstrong Industries. As the second most-powerful tube artillery in the Inner Sphere, the Sniper can cripple or destroy most light and medium BattleMechs with a single hit. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode Uses Sniper Ammo.
Description.Name: Sniper Artillery

Description.Details: The Thumper Artillery Piece is the smallest conventional artillery piece with an effective range of 10.5 kilometers. While an effective Field Artillery weapon, the Thumper is perhaps best known for its use as the main gun on the SLDF's Thor Artillery Vehicle, as well as the Thor's knock-off the Thumper. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode Uses Thumper Ammo.
Description.Name: Thumper Artillery

Description.Details: The Thumper Artillery Cannon is a scaled down version of the Thumper Artillery Piece capable of direct fire. When mounted on BattleMechs, combat vehicles, and AeroSpace Fighters, it provides artillery support at much closer ranges than its cousin. Essentially a snub-nosed version of the Thumper Artillery Piece, the Thumper Artillery Cannon fires a shell at an enemy location like an autocannon. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode Uses Thumper Ammo.
Description.Name: Thumper Artillery

Description.Details: Yeah Boss, this is a Howitzer with a RAC Feeder, what do you want me to say? This is typical Pirates and i dont even want to know what they thought to even try making this! Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode Uses Heavy Rifle Ammo.
Description.Name: Howitzer Cannon

Description.Details: High-Explosive Bombs are one of several common bomb types that can be carried by aerospace and conventional fighters. They are typically carried on external hardpoints common to military aircraft.
Description.Name: ATGM Missile Rack

Description.Details: Cluster Bombs are a special type of High-Explosive Bomb which can cause damage over a wide area. They are typically carried on external hardpoints common to military aircraft.
Description.Name: Bomb Cluster

Description.Details: High-Explosive Bombs are one of several common bomb types that can be carried by aerospace and conventional fighters. They are typically carried on external hardpoints common to military aircraft.
Description.Name: Bomb HE

Description.Details: Inferno Bombs are air-dropped munitions which utilize the same Inferno technology found in other weapon systems. While less common than normal high-explosive bombs, Inferno Bombs are useful for wreaking havoc on enemy formations or 'defoliating' forest or jungle areas
Description.Name: Bomb Inferno

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: Not quite as potent as the air-to-air Arrow missiles introduced by the Lyrans and the Wolves, this much smaller air-to-air missile version had its debut with the allied aerospace forces of the Duchy of Tamarind and Duchess Alys Rousset-Marik’s resistance movement. Built smaller and leaner, these so-called light air-to-air (LAA) missiles can be carried by smaller ﬁghters and create far less drag during atmospheric operations.
Description.Name: Light AA Missile Rack

Description.Details: High-Explosive Bombs are one of several common bomb types that can be carried by aerospace and conventional fighters. They are typically carried on external hardpoints common to military aircraft.
Description.Name: Bomb HE

Description.Details: The Arrow IV is a stand-alone, missile based, artillery system, designed to augment conventional systems such as the Long Tom and the Sniper. It was first introduced by the Terran Hegemony in 2600 and became a staple of the Star League Defense Force. Although the technology to create Arrow IVs was lost during the Star League's collapse, it was recovered by Capellan Confederation engineers in 3044 working off of surviving examples and the Helm Memory Core.
Description.Name: Arrow IV

Description.Details: The Arrow IV is a stand-alone, missile based, artillery system, designed to augment conventional systems such as the Long Tom and the Sniper. It was first introduced by the Terran Hegemony in 2600 and became a staple of the Star League Defense Force. Although the technology to create Arrow IVs was lost during the Star League's collapse, it was recovered by Capellan Confederation engineers in 3044 working off of surviving examples and the Helm Memory Core.
Description.Name: Arrow IV

Description.Details: Cluster Bombs are a special type of High-Explosive Bomb which can cause damage over a wide area. They are typically carried on external hardpoints common to military aircraft.
Description.Name: Bomb Cluster

Description.Details: The 'Daisy Cutter', is one of the largest conventional bombs in common use. As it's name suggests it tends to flatten everything in a wide area.
Description.Name: Bomb Daisy Cutter

Description.Details: High-Explosive Bombs are one of several common bomb types that can be carried by aerospace and conventional fighters. They are typically carried on external hardpoints common to military aircraft.
Description.Name: Bomb Guided

Description.Details: High-Explosive Bombs are one of several common bomb types that can be carried by aerospace and conventional fighters. They are typically carried on external hardpoints common to military aircraft.
Description.Name: Bomb HE

Description.Details: Inferno Bombs are air-dropped munitions which utilize the same Inferno technology found in other weapon systems. While less common than normal high-explosive bombs, Inferno Bombs are useful for wreaking havoc on enemy formations or 'defoliating' forest or jungle areas
Description.Name: Bomb Inferno

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: TWO Hardpoints, Half Ton Carry (VTOL 20 tons minimum mass). Not quite as potent as the air-to-air Arrow missiles introduced by the Lyrans and the Wolves, this much smaller air-to-air missile version had its debut with the allied aerospace forces of the Duchy of Tamarind and Duchess Alys Rousset-Marik’s resistance movement. Built smaller and leaner, these so-called light air-to-air (LAA) missiles can be carried by smaller ﬁghters and create far less drag during atmospheric operations.
Description.Name: Light AA Missile

Description.Details: Thunder Bombs, also known as FASCAM Bombs, are the air-dropped equivalent to Thunder Arrow Missiles developed by the Terran Hegemony in 2623.
Description.Name: Bomb Mines

Description.Details: This missile pod holds a single volley of four, fire and forget, guided missiles comparable to the standard Thunderbolt 5 class. 1 SHOT! VOLATILE!
Description.Name: ML4

Description.Details: Massive Ordnance Air Blast Bombs carry exceptionally large payload of conventional Explosives to obliterate their Target.
Description.Name: Bomb MOAB

Description.Details: Rocket Launchers are cheap, unguided, one-shot missile launchers. Developed by the Marian Hegemony, they often replace more sophisticated equipment that the Periphery nation cannot afford or is unable to repair.1 SHOT! VOLATILE!
Description.Name: RL15

Description.Details: The Railgun is a massive weapon adapted from WarShips to be used on BattleMechs. Clan technology has allowed such a massive weapon to fit a relative small space. The powerful weapon decimates enemy 'Mechs with a single, well-placed shot, but only a few 'Mechs can mount. Uses Railgun Ammo. CASE PROTECTED.
Description.Name: Railgun (C)

Description.Details: The Railgun is a massive weapon adapted from WarShips to be used on BattleMechs. This Original SLDF Era Railgun is heavier and got upgraded capacitors to not explode when destroyed but still is prohibitively heavy and large and can only fit on the largest BattleMechs. Uses Railgun Gauss Ammo.
Description.Name: Railgun

Description.Details: This TAG is hardwired to nearby Arrow IV Support carriers and calls in a precision strike
Description.Name: TAG

Description.Details: This TAG was rewired to call on supporting Fire from nearby Artillery to Shell the target with a selection of munitions
Description.Name: TAG

Description.Details: This TAG was rewired to call on supporting Fire from a orbiting Dropship to fire a naval PPC on the target area
Description.Name: TAG

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: It's a gigantic PPC. The EMP Field is generates is massive affecting units near the target, disrupting myomer and sensor systems. It's hard to focus it on nearby targets due to the large minimum range in safe mode. Left Click on Chance to Hit during battle to toggle the Field Inhibitor. (FIOFF) Has no minimum range penalty and does full damage at close range, but is very likely to fry the weapon. Boosted Mode greatly increases range and damage at the cost of heat and requiring a cooldown period.
Description.Name: ULN PPC

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: The Mech's Movement is reduced.
Description.Name: HAYWIRED

Description.Details: All weapons +6 Recoil.
Description.Name: TWITCHING MYOMER

Description.Details: Need to remind your Neighbor of the Noise? Chug some Budget over to the Rowdy Town over? Cant Afford a Fancy Long Tom? Look no Further we at Quicsell work hard to bring you finest in Weapons, Our Howitzer 2000 is based on well known Lyran designs coming straight from Terra! Uses Heavy Rifle Ammo.
Description.Name: Howitzer Cannon

Description.Details: The Thumper Artillery Piece is the smallest conventional artillery piece with an effective range of 10.5 kilometers. While an effective Field Artillery weapon, the Thumper is perhaps best known for its use as the main gun on the SLDF's Thor Artillery Vehicle, as well as the Thor's knock-off the Thumper. Uses Thumper Ammo.
Description.Name: Thumper Artillery

Description.Details: The Thunderbolt launcher is an offshoot of standard LRM technology. Instead of firing groups of missiles, the Thunderbolt launcher fires a single missile. It suffers from reduced range, and is susceptible to AMS. Uses TBOLT20, TBOLTM15, TBOLTM10, TBOLTM5 Ammo.
Description.Name: Thunderstorm

Description.Details: One of the most powerful and efficient weapons mounted in combat, AC/10s are known for their heavy damage and ability to stagger opponents. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/10s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire. Uses UAC10 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: UAC/10 (C)

Description.Details: Developed by Lubalin Ballistics for the Terran Hegemony, the LB-X Autocannon was a derivative of the standard and relatively primitive Autocannon design. Taking advantage of advanced materials, the company was able to reduce the weight of the weapon for only a slight increase in bulk and mated it with the advanced Mercury-VII targeting system to boost its effective range. Uses LBX10 Ammo.
Description.Name: LBX AC/10 (C)

Description.Details: Intended for use as supporting fire at very long range, AC/2s deal moderate damage with low heat and a large ammunition count per ton. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/2s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire. Uses UAC2 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: UAC/2 (C)

Description.Details: Developed by Lubalin Ballistics for the Terran Hegemony, the LB-X Autocannon was a derivative of the standard and relatively primitive Autocannon design. Taking advantage of advanced materials, the company was able to reduce the weight of the weapon for only a slight increase in bulk and mated it with the advanced Mercury-VII targeting system to boost its effective range. Uses LBX2 Ammo.
Description.Name: LBX AC/2 (C)

Description.Details: The king of the battlefield in terms of raw damage, AC/20s hit harder than any other weapon. However, this comes at the expense of weight, range, and severely limited ammunition. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/20s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire. Uses UAC20 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: UAC/20 (C)

Description.Details: Developed by Lubalin Ballistics for the Terran Hegemony, the LB-X Autocannon was a derivative of the standard and relatively primitive Autocannon design. Taking advantage of advanced materials, the company was able to reduce the weight of the weapon for only a slight increase in bulk and mated it with the advanced Mercury-VII targeting system to boost its effective range. Uses LBX20 Ammo.
Description.Name: LBX AC/20 (C)

Description.Details: Ultra Autocannons boast double the rate of fire of a regular Autocannon, with only moderate increases in weight, size, and heat. The UAC/5 is a reliable long range weapon. Uses UAC5 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: UAC/5 (C)

Description.Details: Developed by Lubalin Ballistics for the Terran Hegemony, the LB-X Autocannon was a derivative of the standard and relatively primitive Autocannon design. Taking advantage of advanced materials, the company was able to reduce the weight of the weapon for only a slight increase in bulk and mated it with the advanced Mercury-VII targeting system to boost its effective range. Uses LBX5 Ammo.
Description.Name: LBX AC/5 (C)

Description.Details: The Rotary Autocannon is based only loosely on the Autocannon. While it has the same bore, it is capable of firing up to six times as many rounds as its standard cousin, allowing it to deal three times the damage of even an Ultra Autocannon. At the same time, each extra shot increases the amount of heat the autocannon builds and increases the chance for a jam. The Clan Variant sports increased range at the cost of increased size. Uses RAC2 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: RAC2 (C)

Description.Details: The Rotary Autocannon is based only loosely on the Autocannon. While it has the same bore, it is capable of firing up to six times as many rounds as its standard cousin, allowing it to deal three times the damage of even an Ultra Autocannon. At the same time, each extra shot increases the amount of heat the autocannon builds and increases the chance for a jam. Like Ultra autocannons, Rotary autocannons are unable to make use of special munitions. The Clan Upgraded Variant barely could improve upon the design but sports increased range and reduced size. Uses RAC5 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: RAC5 (C)

Description.Details: Developed by Clan Wolverine during the early years of the Clans, the Enhanced Extended-Range Particle Projector Cannon or Enhanced ER PPC was something of a midway point between the original ER PPC and the eventual Clan model. It had a damage threshold 20% higher than that of the original ER PPC, but the two were otherwise identical.
Description.Name: ER PPC (C)

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: The Extended Range Flamer (or ER Flamer) is a longer-range, weaker version of the fusion-based Flamer. First developed by Clan Jade Falcon and introduced to the Inner Sphere by the Federated Suns, the Extended Range Flamer uses tighter magnetic coils and a narrower muzzle diameter to increase the weapon's range.
Description.Name: Flamer (C)

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: Flamer weapons are unique in that they deal little physical damage but instead expel superheated plasma, applying substantial heat to their target. When done properly, this can hamper enemy return fire or even cause the targeted unit to shut down from overheating.
Description.Name: Flamer (C)

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: This Plasma Cannon accelerates and superheats a cartridge of 'plastic foam' into an excited state and release it as plasma, creating a tremendous kinetic and thermal impact. Unlike the Capellan version, the Clan Scientists focused exclusively on heat generation, making the Plasma Cannon cause nearly twice as much heat damage on the target. VOLATILE! Uses Plasma Ammo.
Description.Name: Plasma Cannon (C)

Description.Details: High energy residue reduces heat efficiency by 20%.
Description.Name: Plasma Residue

Description.Details: A Gauss Rifle uses electromagnetic charges to accelerate metallic rounds at extremely high speed, dealing massive damage by kinetic force alone. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Gauss Rifle (C)

Description.Details: The Hyper-Assault Gauss Rifle is a variation on the Gauss Rifle developed by Clan Hell's Horses. Hoping to stay ahead of the increasing technological curve, they used similar design principles to the Heavy Gauss Rifle, however, Horse scientists used a series of capacitors and launching tubes to fire a multitude of smaller-caliber slugs. Uses Hyper Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Gauss Rifle HA20 (C)

Description.Details: The Hyper-Assault Gauss Rifle is a variation on the Gauss Rifle developed by Clan Hell's Horses. Hoping to stay ahead of the increasing technological curve, they used similar design principles to the Heavy Gauss Rifle, however, Horse scientists used a series of capacitors and launching tubes to fire a multitude of smaller-caliber slugs. Uses Hyper Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Gauss Rifle HA30 (C)

Description.Details: The Hyper-Assault Gauss Rifle is a variation on the Gauss Rifle developed by Clan Hell's Horses. Hoping to stay ahead of the increasing technological curve, they used similar design principles to the Heavy Gauss Rifle, however, Horse scientists used a series of capacitors and launching tubes to fire a multitude of smaller-caliber slugs. Uses Hyper Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Gauss Rifle HA40 (C)

Description.Details: Developed by Clan Jade Falcon, the Anti-Personnel Gauss Rifle is a scaled-down Gauss Rifle meant for work against conventional infantry and battle armor. Unfortunately, this variant has a fixed capacity of 5 rounds.. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: MagShot Rifle

Description.Details: Clan Star Adder developed the Heavy Lasers to deal more damage, but with an increased heat output. In addition, interference with a BattleMech's sensors means that a Heavy Large Laser is penalized with a +1 to-hit modifier.
Description.Name: Heavy L Laser (C)

Description.Details: Clan Star Adder developed the Heavy Lasers to deal more damage, but with an increased heat output. In addition, interference with a BattleMech's sensors means that a Heavy Medium Laser is penalized with a +1 to-hit modifier.
Description.Name: Heavy M Laser (C)

Description.Details: Clan Star Adder developed the Heavy Lasers to deal more damage, but with an increased heat output. In addition, interference with a BattleMech's sensors means that a Heavy Small Laser is penalized with a +1 to-hit modifier.
Description.Name: Heavy S Laser (C)

Description.Details: After the Star Adders introduced their Heavy Lasers, the other Clans started projects to duplicate or improve on them. Clan Goliath Scorpion was the first clan to introduce an effective Improved Heavy Laser, but it still possessed several tradeoffs that some warriors wouldn't accept. Most notable of these, it could explode if it suffered critical damage, much like a Gauss Rifle.
Description.Name: i. Heavy L Laser (C)

Description.Details: After the Star Adders introduced their Heavy Lasers, the other Clans started projects to duplicate or improve on them. Clan Goliath Scorpion was the first clan to introduce an effective Improved Heavy Laser, but it still possessed several tradeoffs that some warriors wouldn't accept. Most notable of these, it could explode if it suffered critical damage, much like a Gauss Rifle.
Description.Name: i. Heavy M Laser (C)

Description.Details: After the Star Adders introduced their Heavy Lasers, the other Clans started projects to duplicate or improve on them. Clan Goliath Scorpion was the first clan to introduce an effective Improved Heavy Laser, but it still possessed several tradeoffs that some warriors wouldn't accept. Most notable of these, it could explode if it suffered critical damage, much like a Gauss Rifle.
Description.Name: i. Heavy S Laser (C)

Description.Details: Chemical Lasers are not exactly a new invention but a rediscovering of Pre FTL Terra Laser Weapons that relied on a Chemical Process to create the required Energy output for a successful Shot. Uses Chem Large Ammo.
Description.Name: L Chem Laser

Description.Details: An improvement upon standard Large Lasers, Extended-Range Large Lasers extend their effective range at the cost of massive heat generation. Like all Lasers, ER Large Lasers enjoy a baseline accuracy bonus over other weapons.
Description.Name: ER L Laser (C)

Description.Details: The technicians of Clan Wolf were interested in creating an improved pulse laser with extended range. Unlike their Inner Sphere counterparts, who simply pumped more energy into a standard pulse laser, the Wolf techs combined the best features of their Pulse and Extended range lasers to create the ER Pulse Laser family.
Description.Name: L ER Pulse (C)

Description.Details: An improvement upon standard Large Lasers, Large Pulse Lasers use pulses of light instead of a single beam. This results in better accuracy and damage output but with greatly increased heat and weight. Like all Lasers, Large Pulse Lasers enjoy a baseline accuracy bonus over other weapons.
Description.Name: L Pulse Laser (C)

Description.Details: While lost to the Inner Sphere during the devastation of the Succession Wars, the Clans retained the Target Acquisition Gear, but rarely made use of them due to their culture's focus on personal glory rather than supporting roles. Two turn duration, does not stack.
Description.Name: Light TAG (C)

Description.Details: This target was TAG'ed. +1 to hit.
Description.Name: Target Acquired

Description.Details: TAG increases Visibility
Description.Name: Detected

Description.Details: Visual indicator of the TAG effect
Description.Name: TAG MARKED

Description.Details: Chemical Lasers are not exactly a new invention but a rediscovering of Pre FTL Terra Laser Weapons that relied on a Chemical Process to create the required Energy output for a successful Shot. Uses Chem Medium Ammo.
Description.Name: M Chem Laser

Description.Details: An improvement upon standard Medium Lasers, Extended-Range Medium Lasers extend their effective range at the cost of considerable heat generation.
Description.Name: ER M Laser (C)

Description.Details: The technicians of Clan Wolf were interested in creating an improved pulse laser with extended range. Unlike their Inner Sphere counterparts, who simply pumped more energy into a standard pulse laser, the Wolf techs combined the best features of their Pulse and Extended range lasers to create the ER Pulse Laser family.
Description.Name: M ER Pulse (C)

Description.Details: An improvement upon standard Medium Lasers, Medium Pulse Lasers use pulses of light instead of a single beam. This results in better accuracy and damage output but with increased heat and weight. Like all Lasers, Medium Pulse Lasers enjoy a baseline accuracy bonus over other weapons.
Description.Name: M Pulse Laser (C)

Description.Details: The Extended-Range Micro Laser is a very compact version of conventional ER laser weaponry. This laser weapon was specifically developed by Clan Smoke Jaguar for use on very light combat units,
Description.Name: ER Micro Laser (C)

Description.Details: The Micro Pulse Laser was designed by Clan Smoke Jaguar (alongside the ER Micro Laser) primarily for use on their ProtoMechs. It has since spread to all the Clans.
Description.Name: Micro Pulse Laser (C)

Description.Details: Chemical Lasers are not exactly a new invention but a rediscovering of Pre FTL Terra Laser Weapons that relied on a Chemical Process to create the required Energy output for a successful Shot. Uses Chem Small Ammo.
Description.Name: S Chem Laser

Description.Details: An improvement upon standard Small Lasers, Extended-Range Small Lasers extend their effective range at the cost of more heat generation. Like all Lasers, ER Small Lasers enjoy a baseline accuracy bonus over other weapons.
Description.Name: ER S Laser (C)

Description.Details: The technicians of Clan Wolf were interested in creating an improved pulse laser with extended range. Unlike their Inner Sphere counterparts, who simply pumped more energy into a standard pulse laser, the Wolf techs combined the best features of their Pulse and Extended range lasers to create the ER Pulse Laser family.
Description.Name: S ER Pulse (C)

Description.Details: An improvement upon standard Small Lasers, Small Pulse Lasers use pulses of light instead of a single beam. This results in better accuracy and damage output but with greatly increased heat and weight. Like all Lasers, Small Pulse Lasers enjoy a baseline accuracy bonus over other weapons.
Description.Name: S Pulse Laser (C)

Description.Details: The Advanced Tactical Missile system (ATM) was developed by Clan Coyote and allows its users to choose between three different types of ammunition. ATMs also include an integral Artemis IV Fire Control System. Uses ATM Ammo.
Description.Name: ATM 12 (C)

Description.Details: The Advanced Tactical Missile system (ATM) was developed by Clan Coyote and allows its users to choose between three different types of ammunition. ATMs also include an integral Artemis IV Fire Control System. Uses ATM Ammo.
Description.Name: ATM 3 (C)

Description.Details: The Advanced Tactical Missile system (ATM) was developed by Clan Coyote and allows its users to choose between three different types of ammunition. ATMs also include an integral Artemis IV Fire Control System. Uses ATM Ammo.
Description.Name: ATM 6 (C)

Description.Details: The Advanced Tactical Missile system (ATM) was developed by Clan Coyote and allows its users to choose between three different types of ammunition. ATMs also include an integral Artemis IV Fire Control System. Uses ATM Ammo.
Description.Name: ATM 9 (C)

Description.Details: The Improved Advanced Tactical Missile system (iATM) was developed by The Society. Like the Advanced Tactical Missile that it's based on, the iATM system uses a variety of ammunition types and includes an advanced targeting option. Unlike the ATM, the iATM uses a Streak SRM style guidance system to improve accuracy. Uses iATM Ammo.
Description.Name: iATM 12 (C)

Description.Details: The Improved Advanced Tactical Missile system (iATM) was developed by The Society. Like the Advanced Tactical Missile that it's based on, the iATM system uses a variety of ammunition types and includes an advanced targeting option. Uses iATM Ammo.
Description.Name: ATM 3 (C)

Description.Details: The Improved Advanced Tactical Missile system (iATM) was developed by The Society. Like the Advanced Tactical Missile that it's based on, the iATM system uses a variety of ammunition types and includes an advanced targeting option. Unlike the ATM, the iATM uses a Streak SRM style guidance system to improve accuracy. Uses iATM Ammo.
Description.Name: iATM 6 (C)

Description.Details: The Improved Advanced Tactical Missile system (iATM) was developed by The Society. Like the Advanced Tactical Missile that it's based on, the iATM system uses a variety of ammunition types and includes an advanced targeting option. Unlike the ATM, the iATM uses a Streak SRM style guidance system to improve accuracy. Uses iATM Ammo.
Description.Name: iATM 9 (C)

Description.Details: The LRM10 rack of Long-Range Missiles occupies a supporting fire role when mounted on most units, with fairly low damage balanced by low heat and ammunition consumption. Like all LRMs, LRM10s are capable of indirect fire over obstacles and terrain with the benefit of a spotter unit.
Description.Name: LRM10 (C)

Description.Details: The Streak LRM marries the Streak guidance system with a standard LRM launcher. Developed by Clan Coyote technicians as part of Khan Sullivan Koga's revitalization plan, the Streak LRM combines the orignial Streak's ammunition conservation with LRM range. Though successful, the Streak LRM launcher weighs twice as much as the standard Clan LRM launcher (as much as a standard Inner Sphere launcher). The Streak LRM cannot make use of any alternate ammunition types or enhanced guidance systems. Since the Streak LRM requires line of sight to lock on to a target it also lost the ability to make indirect fire attacks. Uses Streak LRM Ammo.
Description.Name: LRM10 (C)

Description.Details: LRM15 Long-Range Missile racks deal substantial damage and stability impact over distance, often found in pairs on indirect-fire support units. Like all LRMs, LRM15s are capable of indirect fire over obstacles and terrain with the benefit of a spotter unit.
Description.Name: LRM15 (C)

Description.Details: The Streak LRM marries the Streak guidance system with a standard LRM launcher. Developed by Clan Coyote technicians as part of Khan Sullivan Koga's revitalization plan, the Streak LRM combines the orignial Streak's ammunition conservation with LRM range. Though successful, the Streak LRM launcher weighs twice as much as the standard Clan LRM launcher (as much as a standard Inner Sphere launcher). The Streak LRM cannot make use of any alternate ammunition types or enhanced guidance systems. Since the Streak LRM requires line of sight to lock on to a target it also lost the ability to make indirect fire attacks. Uses Streak LRM Ammo.
Description.Name: LRM15 (C)

Description.Details: Often found as the secondary weapon on heavier units, LRM20 racks of Long-Range Missiles can deal decent damage while a unit closes range, but they chew through ammunition. Like all LRMs, LRM20s are capable of indirect fire over obstacles and terrain with the benefit of a spotter unit.
Description.Name: LRM20 (C)

Description.Details: The Streak LRM marries the Streak guidance system with a standard LRM launcher. Developed by Clan Coyote technicians as part of Khan Sullivan Koga's revitalization plan, the Streak LRM combines the orignial Streak's ammunition conservation with LRM range. Though successful, the Streak LRM launcher weighs twice as much as the standard Clan LRM launcher (as much as a standard Inner Sphere launcher). The Streak LRM cannot make use of any alternate ammunition types or enhanced guidance systems. Since the Streak LRM requires line of sight to lock on to a target it also lost the ability to make indirect fire attacks. Uses Streak LRM Ammo.
Description.Name: LRM20 (C)

Description.Details: The smallest rack of Long-Range Missiles, LRM5s are efficient and tend to serve as harassment weapons. Like all LRMs, LRM5s are capable of indirect fire over obstacles and terrain with the benefit of a spotter unit.
Description.Name: LRM5 (C)

Description.Details: The Streak LRM marries the Streak guidance system with a standard LRM launcher. Developed by Clan Coyote technicians as part of Khan Sullivan Koga's revitalization plan, the Streak LRM combines the orignial Streak's ammunition conservation with LRM range. Though successful, the Streak LRM launcher weighs twice as much as the standard Clan LRM launcher (as much as a standard Inner Sphere launcher). The Streak LRM cannot make use of any alternate ammunition types or enhanced guidance systems. Since the Streak LRM requires line of sight to lock on to a target it also lost the ability to make indirect fire attacks. Uses Streak LRM Ammo.
Description.Name: LRM5 (C)

Description.Details: As its name implies, the Heavy Machine Gun is less a Machine Gun and more like an automated Grenade Launcher. The HMG does more damage and has a better chance of penetrating and destroying critical components, but weighs twice as much, and suffers from recoil. Uses HMG Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: HMG (C)

Description.Details: The Light Machine Gun fires smaller caliber shells, but boasts a higher rate of fire and increased range over a standard Machine Gun. Uses LMG Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: LMG (C)

Description.Details: Machine Guns deal very little damage, have severely limited range, and depend upon volatile ammunition stores. Uses MG Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: MG (C)

Description.Details: Based on the weapon used by infantry for centuries, the Mech Mortar fires a small shell in a high arc that falls onto the target. Though the Mech Mortar was created by the Terran Hegemony, by 2835 the Succession Wars had relegated it to history. With the reintroduction of the Anti-Missile System, engineers revived the Mech Mortar concept. The munitions used by the mortars, though often possessing limited guidance packages, weren't destroyed by AMS systems in tests. Mortar shells also proved very adaptable, accepting several types of payloads. Uses Mortar Ammo.
Description.Name: Mortar/2

Description.Details: Based on the weapon used by infantry for centuries, the Mech Mortar fires a small shell in a high arc that falls onto the target. Though the Mech Mortar was created by the Terran Hegemony, by 2835 the Succession Wars had relegated it to history. With the reintroduction of the Anti-Missile System, engineers revived the Mech Mortar concept. The munitions used by the mortars, though often possessing limited guidance packages, weren't destroyed by AMS systems in tests. Mortar shells also proved very adaptable, accepting several types of payloads. Uses Mortar Ammo.
Description.Name: Mortar/4

Description.Details: An improvement upon standard PPCs, Extended-Range PPCs greatly extend their effective range at the cost of incredible heat generation. ER PPCs also generate a mild EM field that degrades the firing capability of their target.
Description.Name: ER PPC (C)

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: This Launcher fires a single NARC beacon that attaches itself to the enemy and emits a homing signal for all friendly weapons.
Description.Name: Narc Launcher (C)

Description.Details: A tiny rack of Short-Range Missiles, SRM2s deal little damage but also cost almost nothing in the way of weight, space, heat, or ammunition consumption. As for all SRMs, SRM2 shots deal above-average stability impact per hit compared to other weapons.
Description.Name: SRM2 (C)

Description.Details: The Streak SRM-2 launcher is a prototype SRM that uses an advanced active guidance system to track targets, but at the cost of increased weight and heat generation. Uses Streak SRM Ammo.
Description.Name: Streak SRM2 (C)

Description.Details: The midtier rack of Short-Range Missiles, SRM4s deal good damage for comparatively few negatives other than their inherently short range and need for ammunition. As for all SRMs, SRM4 shots deal above-average stability impact per hit compared to other weapons.
Description.Name: SRM4 (C)

Description.Details: The Streak SRM-4 launcher is a prototype SRM that uses an advanced active guidance system to track targets, but at the cost of increased weight and heat generation. Uses Streak SRM Ammo.
Description.Name: Streak SRM4 (C)

Description.Details: SRM6s are the largest available rack of Short-Range Missiles and pack considerable punch while also being lightweight. As for all SRMs, SRM6 shots deal above-average stability impact per hit compared to other weapons.
Description.Name: SRM6 (C)

Description.Details: The Streak SRM-6 launcher is a prototype SRM that uses an advanced active guidance system to track targets, but at the cost of increased weight and heat generation. Uses Streak SRM Ammo.
Description.Name: Streak SRM6 (C)

Description.Details: An incredibly rare prototype C3 Master unit, the C3 Overlord Command Unit is the pinnacle of Kuritan design and research into the C3 Network. The bulky Overlord Command Unit features a variety of targeting and command technologies but, ultimately, was retired in favor of individual components that are easier and faster to manufacture.
Description.Name: C3 Network Overlord Command Unit

Description.Details: This target was TAG'ed. +1 to hit.
Description.Name: Target Acquired

Description.Details: TAG increases Visibility
Description.Name: Detected

Description.Details: Provides detailed information on enemy units
Description.Name: Advanced Sensors

Description.Details: Provides + 1 Initiative and several buffs.
Description.Name: Command Consoles

Description.Details: Prevents Injuries against a MechWarrior.
Description.Name: MAX INJURIES INCREASED

Description.Details: Provides + 1 Initiative and several buffs.
Description.Name: Command Consoles

Description.Details: Prevents Injuries against a MechWarrior.
Description.Name: MAX INJURIES INCREASED

Description.Details: Provides a bonus to actions that generate Morale.
Description.Name: MORALE GENERATION INCREASED

Description.Details: Shows their vision when lancemates move
Description.Name: Vision Sharing

Description.Details: A unique TAG system hardwired to the Cockpits FCS system, trading the units Fire Control Systems for a powerful TAG.
Description.Name: TAG

Description.Details: This target was TAG'ed. +1 to hit.
Description.Name: Target Acquired

Description.Details: TAG increases Visibility
Description.Name: Detected

Description.Details: Visual indicator of the TAG effect
Description.Name: TAG MARKED

Description.Details: This does Look like a pretty basic AC10 Class Weapon, but it fires a steady stream of Ultra Munitions. Uses UAC10 Ammo.
Description.Name: AutoCannon

Description.Details: This 'Bolter' seems to be a development similar to the AutoCannon but trading weight for range Uses RAC2 Ammo.
Description.Name: Heavy Bolter

Description.Details: While it seems to be similar to a Thunderbolt Missile does this missile carry a sophistic Shaped-Charge Warhead with advanced Guidance.
Description.Name: Hunter-Killer Missile

Description.Details: This Chemical Laser seems to have been designed to push out a intense blast with a very short duration but being able to punch through Armor similar to a Gauss Rifle. Uses Chem Large Ammo.
Description.Name: LasCannon

Description.Details: An Automatic Recoilless Pistol firing Gyrojet HEAP 'Bullets'. Battle Armor Weapons can only be mounted on Powered Armor Units.
Description.Name: Bolter

Description.Details: This is 3 Plasma Cannons with a single rapid feeding mechanism that fails to properly create the plasma and mostly just lobs hot plastic at whatever is infront of it.... I know pirates are known to imbibe but you gotta stop brining me this Boss! Uses Plasma Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Plasma Cannon

Description.Details: Medium Lasers are lightweight with respectable damage. Because of this, at least one can be found mounted on most units that cross the battlefield.
Description.Name: M Laser

Description.Details: This was an Advanced Tactical Missile system, before someone turned it into this wreckage. This is the famous case of getting a weapon into some nutcases hand but no ammo for it. The whole system has been turned upside down, the Artemis got completely yanked out and they put a jury rigged RAC-feeder in its place, allowing the speed at which it launches Missiles to be adjusted, but i'd be carefull setting it to high speed, though slower speeds improve its lock on speed. VOLATILE! Uses LRM/MRM/SRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to Hit during battle to switch firing mode, LRM, MRM, SRM
Description.Name: ATM 12 (PRT)

Description.Details: This was an Advanced Tactical Missile system, before someone turned it into this wreckage. This is the famous case of getting a weapon into some nutcases hand but no ammo for it. The whole system has been turned upside down, the Artemis got completely yanked out and they put a jury rigged RAC-feeder in its place, allowing the speed at which it launches Missiles to be adjusted, but i'd be carefull setting it to high speed, though slower speeds improve its lock on speed. VOLATILE! Uses LRM/MRM/SRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to Hit during battle to switch firing mode, LRM, MRM, SRM
Description.Name: ATM 3 (PRT)

Description.Details: This was an Advanced Tactical Missile system, before someone turned it into this wreckage. This is the famous case of getting a weapon into some nutcases hand but no ammo for it. The whole system has been turned upside down, the Artemis got completely yanked out and they put a jury rigged RAC-feeder in its place, allowing the speed at which it launches Missiles to be adjusted, but i'd be carefull setting it to high speed, though slower speeds improve its lock on speed. VOLATILE! Uses LRM/MRM/SRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to Hit during battle to switch firing mode, LRM, MRM, SRM
Description.Name: ATM 6 (PRT)

Description.Details: This was an Advanced Tactical Missile system, before someone turned it into this wreckage. This is the famous case of getting a weapon into some nutcases hand but no ammo for it. The whole system has been turned upside down, the Artemis got completely yanked out and they put a jury rigged RAC-feeder in its place, allowing the speed at which it launches Missiles to be adjusted, but i'd be carefull setting it to high speed, though slower speeds improve its lock on speed. VOLATILE! Uses LRM/MRM/SRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to Hit during battle to switch firing mode, LRM, MRM, SRM
Description.Name: ATM 9 (PRT)

Description.Details: Someone carved X's and O's all over the barrel of this poor AC/10 and then let rust set in.  I tried to wash the scum off of it and it looked like it was bleeding.  I'd suggest you send it out the air lock.
Description.Name: Pirate AC/10

Description.Details: This definitely is a LBX. I don't know if it's a stroke of genius or not, but they put a 'choke' on it and did all kinds of nasty to the ammo feed to reduce the spread and improve the damage. It definitely wont hit as well and kick like a mule, but whoever you point it at will feel it.
Description.Name: LBX AC/10 (P)

Description.Details: I'm not sure who thought this was a good idea but someone welded together a bunch rifle barrels and crude breach blocks together. Thank the gods they marked them because there are two different calibers. Uses Medium Rifle Ammo.
Description.Name: Pepperbox Rifle

Description.Details: Yeah Boss, this crap should not even exist, but still here it is. It's got bits and pieces of pretty much every AutoCannon you can get, here is a Clan UAC feeder, that's an LBX Barrel there, HVAC railing and stabilizers..... and to top all this 'fuckery' off it's got a poem about someone named Thor written all over it.... Uses ANY AC/UAC/LBX/10 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: UAC/10

Description.Details: Whoever added the spikes on the barrel actually did a pretty good job; not one of them bent or off-center.  Leave it to a pirate to put that much effort into useless spikes.
Description.Name: Pirate AC/10

Description.Details: Melee attacks deal 16 more damage.
Description.Name: SPIKEY

Description.Details: The king of the battlefield, absolutely ruined by pirates. They've cut off half the barrel, made it hot-load two slugs at a time, and scratched obscenities all over it. They've basically turned this AC/20 into a sawed-off shotgun. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Pirate AC/20

Description.Details: So pirates are a superstitious lot but this is just ridiculous. The barrel has 666 carved down the side, a pentagram carved near the loading breach and, just for shits and giggles, a stick figure of a man with horns holding a pitchfork carved to look like he is humping the front of the barrel.  Pirates are just stupid....
Description.Name: Devil's AC/20

Description.Details: You shouldn't let pirates touch anything! I'm not sure what they were trying to do with this thing. Use it at your own risk.
Description.Name: Pirate AC/5

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: Ya know Boss, there's these days when you look at something and should just walk away.... This is a UAC/10, with 2 Rifles welded onto it and all barrels are fed through whatever that is. Uses RAC10 Ammo. VOLATILE! Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: RAC/10

Description.Details: Technically its not a RAC2 but some junkhead welded a couple AC2 together, linked their triggers and added additional feeding belts ....and i have no idea what *that* does. Uses Heavy RAC2 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: Pirate RAC2

Description.Details: So look, some madman who thinks he is a tech wired three UAC20s together with barbed wire. Then cold welded them in place with some janky threeway feed system that somehow uses what looks like a gear driven belt. So look, this thing should have a ton of firepower, but Commander I wouldn't trust it to not rattle the arm off of the Mech it's mounted on. Uses RAC20 Ammo. VOLATILE! Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: RAC20

Description.Details: However a Pirate got their hands on a functional RAC5, and however they couldn't just leave it well enough alone! They increased the ammo feed, removed the safety limiters and for good measure torched occult symbols all over it.... Uses Heavy RAC5 Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: Pirate RAC5

Description.Details: Leave it to some Periphery Junkhead to take a perfectly fine LBX and Redneck it into a 'Sawed Off Shotgun' and scribble stuff all over, where do they get this stuff... 'Klaatu barada nihikturhun'..... Uses LBX20 Ammo.
Description.Name: Sawed-Off LBX/20

Description.Details: Melee attacks deal 50% Extra damage.
Description.Name: Hand Melee Damage

Description.Details: Someone took a heavy vehicle flamer and removed the igniter on several of the sprayer's sub-nozzles so they just spray liquid. There's also a recipe for a custom fuel mix etched onto the tank. It looks pretty legit, except that I doubt ''the blood of your enemies'' is strictly required. Uses Heavy Flamer Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Heavy Flamer (PRT)

Description.Details: This unit is coated with burning chemicals. It will gain 15 heat on its next activation.
Description.Name: Tastes Like Burning

Description.Details: The barrel of this flamer has been crimped at the end, probably in some moronic attempt to make it shoot farther.  You'll be lucky if it doesn't just blow up in your face.
Description.Name: Pirate Flamer

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: Boss, I don't know what this is, but some jokester welded a flamer onto the cockpit, and hotwired a heat bank into it that runs through a coffee machine. This can only be installed in the head.
Description.Name: Pirate Cockpit

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: Has a Flame Breath.
Description.Name: MAX HEAT INCREASED

Description.Details: This ''Snub Nose'' Gauss Rifle basically just is a broken Railgun Barrel cut short and welded to a Heavy Gauss System, theres nothing properly 'snub nose' about this.. Uses Heavy Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Heavy Gauss Rifle

Description.Details: Soo someone got their Hands on pieces of a couple Taser, couldn't figure out the EM Feed and instead of leaving all is well, just made it fire a modified Harpoon with a SRM's Tandem Charge.... If i hear one more Whaling joke someone gets airlocked! Uses Harpoon Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Harpoon Rifle

Description.Details: Harpooned ye Landlubber! 15% reduced Unsteady threshhold.
Description.Name: Reel 'Er In

Description.Details: How pirates even got their hands on a Gauss Rifle is beyond me. They've modified the barrel and breach to only shoot ammunition that's been shaved down into spikes that caused the end of the barrel to explode. It's a whole day's work just to make a ton of spiked ammunition. You're not going to make us do that, are you? Uses Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Pirate Gauss Rifle

Description.Details: Some Pirate got their hands on a silver bullet gauss rifle and thought it was a good idea to add an ammo feeder system that accepts basically anything remotely magnetic, even frontloading Scrap Metal from the Field!... There has been broken down knives and spoons in there.... Uses Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE! Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch to less safe alternate firing modes
Description.Name: Silver Ware Gauss

Description.Details: A Gauss Rifle uses electromagnetic charges to accelerate metallic rounds at extremely high speed, dealing massive damage by kinetic force alone. Uses Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Gauss Rifle

Description.Details: The Grazer is one of many dead end attempts at producing a next generation directed energy weapon. Particles in the Gamma Ray range are not as easily stopped by solid matter as conventional light resulting in improved armor penetration, but only on par with an equivalent autocannon. Mounted on the, also experimental, Urbanlord, it proved effective in fighting to Free Tiaw...St. Ives. However the system was ultimately judged too difficult to manufacture on a large scale, and some mechwarriors reported finding it's multiple firing modes distracting and difficult to manage in the heat of battle. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: Grazer Large

Description.Details: This 'PAAARTYCANNON' is barely more then 4 Chemical Lasers jury rigged together with a Randomized Focusing Lense to make it change Colours During firing... Someone scratched 'Sta-sta-Staaying Aliive' on it... Uses Chem Medium Ammo.
Description.Name: M Chem Laser

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: Apparently it wasn't enough to just weld some Medium Chemicals together, they HAD to do the same to Large ones too.... this doesn't smell like Machine Oil either... Uses Chem Large Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: L Chem Laser

Description.Details: Boss, I'm speechless. I have no idea how it works and the rat's nest of wires and mismatched circuits inside is absolutely horrifying. But this is basically a Streak Laser. If fires a constant low power spotting beam and has sensors to analyze reflections. You can hold down the trigger but it will only discharge when it's pointed at something with armor plating.
Description.Name: L Laser

Description.Details: This unit is coated with burning chemicals.
Description.Name: INFERNO

Description.Details: Whatever this is I don't even know even know where to start, it is as if some Punk heard stories of Heavy Medium Lasers and decided rewiring a PPC Capacitor into a broken down Large Laser does the same..... Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: M H Laser (P)

Description.Details: This is terrible. A pirate finds pulse technology and in an effort to improve it cracks open the focusing chamber and hot-wires the capacitors into a feedback loop. You've got to stop bringing me this crap.
Description.Name: Pirate L Pulse Laser

Description.Details: Gotta leave it to a pirate to fix a broken Chem Laser Autoloader by just wiring the ammo into the assembly with a old terran tubular magazine feed like a pump action shotgun. 10 rounds. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: M Chem Laser

Description.Details: Yeah Just when you believe they've sniffed the last Moonshine, one of them gets the idea to weld a bunch of Medium Chem Lasers together with half working RAC feeder.... Theres a cup welded in here.... Uses Chem Medium Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: M Chem Laser

Description.Details: Someone took this whole pulse idea very seriously.
Description.Name: M Pulse Laser

Description.Details: I am actually impressed, aside from it's misaligned focusing Lense and the Smell is this 'thing' in an excellent condition. Uses Chem Small Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: S Chem Laser

Description.Details: Captain, this piece is either from a genius or a moron. The Maniac put a filter on the output to essentially ''brand'' the target. Even worse they wrote a random generator to always 'paint' something else ... eff these punks!
Description.Name: TAGGER

Description.Details: This target was TAG'ed. +1 to hit.
Description.Name: Target Acquired

Description.Details: TAG increases Visibility
Description.Name: Detected

Description.Details: Visual indicator of the TAG effect
Description.Name: TAG MARKED

Description.Details: This 'was' a Large Pulse Laser, and someone hot-wired a TAG straight into the system, overloaded the capacitors and then managed to break the focusing system anyway.
Description.Name: Death Stare

Description.Details: This target was TAG'ed. +1 to hit.
Description.Name: Target Acquired

Description.Details: TAG increases Visibility
Description.Name: Detected

Description.Details: Some shit rewired the Guidance system so poorly, and so many times, that I'm pretty sure it would just hit whatever's closest, including yourself. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Pirate LRM10

Description.Details: The radar transmitter and guidance computer should be right here, but of course, they're not. I don't have any idea where the missiles are going to go when you fire it.
Description.Name: Pirate LRM17

Description.Details: This WAS an LRM20, they somehow managed to override any safeties, removed the guidance computer, and sped up the feeding mechanism. If this explodes and sends you after Kerensky don't ask me to fix it. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Pirate LRM30

Description.Details: Ah yes, the age-old pirate adage: 'if you put a spike on the nose of each missile, you will increase their pointedness'. You're not seriously considering using this, are you?
Description.Name: Pirate LRM5

Description.Details: This is three Thunderbolt missile launchers bolted together and wired to a single guidance system. The guidance computer is horribly overworked, so expect a drop in accuracy. The maker of this monstrosity also built some kind of overdrive mode for the launcher - apparently as a personal challenge to break every engineering safety standard in existence. Uses TBOLT10 Ammo.
Description.Name: TBM30

Description.Details: The second and third barrels on this machine gun have been arc welded together and somehow jammed into the frame here. The feeding mechanism has been looped around to feed the additional breaches as well. This entire rat's nest weighs twice what it would take to mount a couple more machine guns in the first place. Uses HMG Ammo. Left Click on Ammocount/Damage value during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: Pirate HMG Array

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: I am dumbfounded. This dizzying array of components was jammed into a medium laser in an attempt to extract an ounce more accuracy out of an already accurate design. It's just plain dumb, boss.
Description.Name: Pirate M Laser

Description.Details: In my in-depth study of pirate-ology I've discovered that if you put spikes on it, it'll do more damage.  If you're the kind to down a handle of rum and shoot yourself out of an airlock this design will make complete sense to you.
Description.Name: Pirate ER M Laser

Description.Details: Melee attacks deal 6 more damage.
Description.Name: SPIKEY

Description.Details: Yeah Boss, This definitely is a MML firing 20 Missiles, for being hacked together from 3 different Launcher's im actually impressed that it wont blow up in your face. Uses SRM/LRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to toggle between SRM/LRM.
Description.Name: MML20

Description.Details: This MRM40 at first glance seems as a normal weapon system. However after a careful look into its interiors reveals, that some 'genius' wanted to speed it up, so it shoots more missiles and he achieved it, by jury rigging the reload mechanism with installing a small caliber RAC-feeder. I am pretty sure, this is a one-shot weapon, as its gonna jam itself, if using a mode to fire more missiles than it should. VOLATILE! Uses MRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: Pirate MRM40

Description.Details: So, someone hotwired this 'Palasma' Cannon into the Mech's Cooling systems, basically routing most of the heat into the Plasma chamber, definitely increased the Toroid state of the Reaction, also possibly blowing up your heatsinks Uses Plasma Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Plasma Cannon

Description.Details: I dont wanna know what Moonshine was responsible for this. Someone hotwired a Clan and Standard Plasma Cannon together but with only 1 feeding system. On the upside this spreads the Plasma reaction all over its impact area. On the other hand it probably explodes. Uses Plasma Ammo. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Plasma Cannon

Description.Details: High energy residue reduces heat efficiency by 15%.
Description.Name: Plasma Residue

Description.Details: Yeah Boss, this is still a Light PPC, and yes that's parts of an capacitor where the shielding should be, but somehow this helps the Particle Charge actually grow the further it travels. Would be a stroke of Genius if that focusing lens could be remotely calibrated. Can Toggle Between Rapid Fire or Overcharging the Capacitator, exchanging Reliability for Additional Shots or Damage Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: LPPC

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: The Snub-Nose PPC is to a Particle Projector Cannon as a sawed-off is to a shotgun. And in typical periphery fashion they thought to improve it further by removing the EM Shielding, interfering with the 'Mech's Systems and spreading the shot out.... VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Snub-Nose-PPC

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: I... See Boss, this is a Heavy PPC but the safeties have been removed and a Capacitor is straight up wired into it, if you fire this too fast, it will overload and shut down ...if you're lucky. Can Toggle Between Fast Charge or Scatterblasr the Capacitator, exchanging Reliability for Accuracy or Shotgun like shot Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: HPPC

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: Particle Projector Cannons are technological Marvel's, that is until some paint sniffing jackass comes along and hardwires a Capacitator straight into the gun. Theres a 'Safetys are for lusahs' scratched in where they should be!. Can Toggle Between Fast or Overcharging the Capacitator, exchanging Reliability for Accuracy or Damage Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: PPC

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: It looks like someone combined the burned out and broken parts of two PPCs to create one barely-functional PPC. The electromagnetic field generation is unstable. You're likely to get zapped if you walk too close to this thing.
Description.Name: Pirate PPC

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: You gotta admire the perseverance of whatever jackass came up with the idea of hotwiring a capacitator into the PPC, he made a whole line out of it, and didn't once stop to ask what he does to these beauties. Besides does this Capacitator either vastly increase its range, or trades it for a Brutal Punch. Can Toggle Between Extreme Range or Overcharging the Capacitator, exchanging Reliability for Range or Damage Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: ER PPC

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: This marvel of engineering has been violated in so many ways. I can not begin to decipher what it's been through. And no, the fake magazine attached to its underside can not be removed. It is somehow integrated into the containment field that keeps this thing from blowing up when fired. VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Pirate ER PPC

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: Someone modified the flux capacitor to generate a more debilitating EM field. Problem is, it looks like it affects the user more than it does the target. Additionally, all the designations and serial numbers have had the C's scratched out and replaced with what I can only guess is a Z. Z's, scratched all over this thing. The Tech's nicknamed it the Pride Blaster and will turn any sensor output into Fabolous readouts.VOLATILE! Left Click on Chance to Hit during battle to toggle the Field Inhibitor. (FIOFF) Has no minimum range penalty but can Misfire.
Description.Name: Pirate PPZ

Description.Details: [AMT] Difficulty to all of this unit's attacks until its next activation.
Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED

Description.Details: EM Interference reduces sensor efficiency.
Description.Name: Fabolous!

Description.Details: This isn't quite your run of the mill Heavy Rifle. It's bore diameter matches Thunderbolt 10 missiles it has an adapted the feed system to handle them in addition to normal shells. It's better quality than a lot of weird periphery junk, even though it looks hand made. It's designer has stenciled the word ''Shillelagh'' onto the barrel, and was thoughtful enough to etch the specs for the custom zero-spin sabots the missiles need onto the inside of the top cover. Can toggle between missile and rifle mode. Firing missiles has a 12% jam chance, mitigated by Gunnery Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode Uses Heavy Rifle Ammo. Uses TBOLT10 Ammo.
Description.Name: Heavy Rifle

Description.Details: If you slap three Small Lasers together, and jury-rig the mount point and power supply, you'll get this piece of work. I didn't know that duct tape could petrify like that. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode
Description.Name: Pirate S Laser

Description.Details: This thing was hacked together using a scrap Streak SRM2 and a NARC missile beacon launcher. It only fires if it has a solid lock, but uses two narc pods at once. The reloading system is trash, it looks like they had to slow it way down to keep it from jamming. Uses NARC Ammo.
Description.Name: Pirate NARC

Description.Details: Though this may look like an SRM4, it's not. Some moron welded together two SRM2s, and then stuck on some red LEDs that blink randomly and for no apparent reason.
Description.Name: Pirate SRM4

Description.Details: This monstrosity is actually two SRM4s strapped together with what looks like bailing wire and a mutilated power coupling system.  Several of the missile tubes will occasionally fail to fire.
Description.Name: Pirate SRM6

Description.Details: Commander this is the dumbest thing I've ever seen. Some idiot wanted their streaks to fire every time, even if they didn't have a lock. So they hotwired the FCS. It's basically just an SRM6 now, but it weighs more. Uses Streak SRM Ammo.
Description.Name: Pirate ''Streak'' SRM6

Description.Details: Target Acquisition Gear for Powered Infantry used to mark targets for close support Artillery
Description.Name: TAG

Description.Details: This TAG was designed to be carried by Powered Infantry
Description.Name: TAG

Description.Details: This target was TAG'ed. +1 to hit.
Description.Name: Target Acquired

Description.Details: TAG increases Visibility
Description.Name: Detected

Description.Details: Visual indicator of the TAG effect
Description.Name: TAG MARKED

Description.Details: A Battle Armor Point Defense System, allowing to intercept nearby enemy Missiles. Battle Armor Weapons can only be mounted on Powered Armor Units.
Description.Name: BA AMS

Description.Details: Construction and engineering 'Mechs use Laser Cutter to take junk apart. In an emergency these pinpoint beams can be used against 'Mechs in melee combat. Like all Industrial weapons, Laser Cutters suffer a small inherent penalty to hit.
Description.Name: Laser Cutter

Description.Details: A Battle Armor Flamethrower. Battle Armor Weapons can only be mounted on Powered Armor Units.
Description.Name: Flamer

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: A Battle Armor 'Harpoon'. For pirates that ain't be half as stupid as what else they jury rig, this allows the squad to topple and capture pretty much any mech. Battle Armor Weapons can only be mounted on Powered Armor Units.
Description.Name: Harpoon Rifle

Description.Details: Harpooned ye Landlubber! 15% reduced Unsteady threshhold.
Description.Name: Reel 'Er In

Description.Details: A Battle Armor Heavy Plasma Rifle carrying 12 shots. Battle Armor Weapons can only be mounted on Powered Armor Units.
Description.Name: Plasma Rifle

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: High energy residue reduces heat efficiency.
Description.Name: Plasma Residue

Description.Details: A Battle Armor 'King David' Gauss Rifle, carrying 8 shots. Battle Armor Weapons can only be mounted on Powered Armor Units.
Description.Name: MagShot Rifle

Description.Details: The Thunderbolt Missile was developed for the arenas of Solaris. Unlike most missile systems, the Thunderbolt was a single missile that smashed into its target. Though it was effective in the arenas, it didn't see widespread use in the field because the single missile was very vulnerable to Anti-Missile Systems. The missile launcher, though small, was awkward to mount and would only fit on the left or right torso of a 'Mech.
Description.Name: Thunderbolt Missile

Description.Details: This was an Advanced Tactical Missile system, before someone turned it into this wreckage. This is the famous case of getting a weapon into some nutcases hand but no ammo for it. The whole system has been turned upside down, the Artemis got completly yanked out and they put a jury rigged RAC-feeder in its place, allowing the speed at which it launches Missiles to be adjusted, but i'd be carefull setting it to high speed, though slower speeds improve its lock on speed. VOLATILE! Uses LRM/MRM/SRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to Hit during battle to switch firing mode, LRM, MRM, SRM
Description.Name: ATM 9 (PRT)

Description.Details: Boss, I don't know what this is, but some jokester welded a flamer onto the cockpit, and hotwired a heat bank into it that runs through a coffee machine. This can only be installed in the head.
Description.Name: Pirate Cockpit

Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: Provides + 1 Initiative and several buffs.

Description.Details: This is the most powerful Fusion Powered Flamer known, capable of producing a flame hot enough to melt even the toughest armour. It is capable to ignite a targets Armor, leaving it burning for 2 turns. Stacks 4 times and refreshes duration on hit.
Description.Name: Flamer Prometheus

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Details: Melted Armor generates ongoing heat
Description.Name: Prometheus Flame

Description.Details: The Fluid Gun is nothing more than a militarized Fluid Sprayer system. By toughening the feed lines and storage tanks, the engineers of Solaris VII created a system roughly equivalent to a Flamer. Unlike the flamer however, the Fluid Gun can store and spray a variety of fluid types. Clever arena fighters have used water, oil slicks, Inferno Fuel, Cooling Fluid, and Corrosive Fluids in matches. Uses Fluid Cannisters (Ammo).
Description.Name: Fluid Gun

Description.Details: Reduce Heat Damage by 1%
Description.Name: Heat Damage SoftCap

Description.Name: BLINDED

Description.Name: Gauss Rifle

Description.Details: The Anti-Personnel Gauss Rifle is a scaled-down Gauss Rifle meant for work against conventional infantry and battle armor. The AP Gauss Rifle Battery is a total of eight AP Gauss Rifles slaved together to unleash a tidal wave of flachettes into an opponent while removing the redundant bulk and fire control burden of eight individual weapons. This weapons has a fixed capacity of 64 rounds.. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to switch firing mode VOLATILE!
Description.Name: AP Gauss Rifle Battery

Description.Details: This Prototype Hammerfist Heavy Gauss Rifle is permanently affixed to the Dreka Chassis, sporting superior Range and Damage to the final production model at cost of runnign very hot with a chance that the Capacitator may fail to charge in time.VOLATILE!
Description.Name: Heavy Gauss Rifle

Description.Details: HGR hit destablized Gyro, reducing stability threshhold by 10%.

Description.Details: This poor mangled and tortured Weapon was a Star League era relic, a Masterpiece of lost Technology, a 'Rail Gun'. Then some Pirates found it and made it 'working' again, the chambering system is a complete mess that only accepts 'Canisters' with 'Magnetic Materials'. VOLATILE! Uses Railgun Ammo. Reduced Damage from Movement
Description.Name: Railgun
